title.narrative: Respecting human rights in the operations of Finnish companies' operations in India

description.narrative: This joint project between Finnwatch and Cividep contributes towards the creation of decent jobs and livelihood opportunities in India especially for women. To achieve this long-term goal protection of fundamental labour rights both in law and in practice in India is essential as are implementation of gender rights at workplace and enabling and empowering of workers themselves to negotiate better terms and conditions of work.Continuation project aims to achieve its objectives by conducting primary research into working conditions in the subsidiaries and suppliers? manufacturing units in India of companies operating in Finland. Research results are published (at least 2 reports 4 research articles) and consumers (reach at least 15 million) mobilised to demand more responsibility from the companies. Project partners will engage in constructive and solution-oriented dialogue with the companies encouraging and supporting them to increase and improve human rights due diligence in their operations (at least 20 comp anies).Project?s main beneficiaries are workers in the above-mentioned manufacturing units. At least 100 workers will be reached through trainings in labour rights each year of the project (400 in total) 70% of whom will be women Dalits or indigenous peopl e. In order to create an enabling environment for workers to organise training on business and human rights (BHR) is offered to the Indian managements of 2 such units each year. Workers are further supported through capacity-building workshops for their re presentative grass-roots organisations (at least 10 in total).The project also mobilises Finnish/European companies (at least 10) to influence the ongoing labour reforms in India which are feared to considerably weaken the legal protection of labour rights in India. The continuation phase introduces a new project partner Hansel a Finnish state-owned limited company and the government's central purchasing body for the work done in the electronics sector.The project will strengthen Cividep's networks and coll aboration with grass-roots NGOs and trade unions and its capacity to conduct field research and project management skills.
